text: all throughout the morning we were in

so clashes with the police started then

gas and then the the protesters forced
their way towards Parliament to burn the

there's just black smoke ever in the

that talk about marching to Kasim Kasim

the president's the youth especially say
that they have no prospects and it's
it's really about the youth and the

in their country that most of the

that they've had enough that 27 years is
already too long that they haven't seen
the their country been being developed
and that none of the promises were kept
well just two days ago with the BBC's
focus on Africa program interviewed
President Blais Campari and here is what
he had to say about the proposed
referendum which led to these protests
the Constitution says that the president
of Burkina Faso may consult the people
on all issues of national interest why
would we want to prevent the president
to do so we cannot prevent the citizen
to be free in this country my concern
today is not to build a future for
